title: Panama buries last 13 bodies of dozens of bus crash victims
description: Panama has buried the last 13 unclaimed bodies from a Feb. 15 bus crash that killed over three dozen migrants from several countries

title: Canada suspect in cop killings had prior mental health call
description: Canadian police say a 16-year-old killed two police officers in the hall of his apartment, then struggled with his mother over the firearm before shooting her and killing himself

title: Three dead in stabbings at apartment in eastern Canada
description: Three people were found stabbed to death Friday inside an apartment in the eastern Canadian city of Montreal, and police have a suspect in custody

title: Haiti PM turns to military for help in fighting gangs
description: Prime Minister Ariel Henry says he intends to activate all of the country’s security forces to fight increasingly powerful gangs

title: 6 women who went missing in Mexico were killed, burned
description: Prosecutors in Mexico confirmed Friday that six women who went missing on March 7 were killed and their bodies burned by a gang of armed men

title: 3 police dead in Mexico City shootout with cartel gunmen
description: Three police officers and one suspect are dead and seven suspected drug cartel members have been arrested following a dramatic gun battle on the eastern edge of Mexico City

title: Palestinians: 1 killed by Israeli army fire in West Bank
description: The Israeli military says troops shot a Palestinian who approached soldiers and pulled a knife near the city of Ramallah in the occupied West Bank

title: Mexican president: lack of hugs caused US fentanyl crisis
description: Mexico’s president has said that U.S. families are to blame for the fentanyl overdose crisis because they don’t hug their kids enough

title: Discarded explosives in South Sudan kill 10, including kids
description: At least 10 people including children have been killed in South Sudan after coming across explosives

title: 2nd Vatican official says pope OK'd ransom payments for nun
description: A second high-ranking Vatican official has said Pope Francis authorized spending hundreds of thousands of euros in ransom payments to try to free a nun who was kidnapped by al-Qaida-linked militants in Mali

title: US ships mega generators to ease outages in Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Rico’s governor says the U.S. government has shipped three mega generators to the island to help stabilize the U.S. territory’s rickety electric grid and minimize ongoing outages

title: ICC issues arrest warrant for Putin over war crimes in Ukraine
description: Moscow doesn't recognize the International Criminal Court and Vladimir Putin is unlikely to be detained, but the warrants carry symbolic weight.

title: Ann Summers lingerie chain boss Jacqueline Gold dies at 62
description: Jacqueline Gold, who helped make lingerie and sex toys a female-friendly mainstream business as head of Britain’s Ann Summers chain, has died

title: Syrian Kurdish force says it lost 9 fighters in Iraq crash
description: The main U.S.-backed and Kurdish-led force in northeastern Syria says it lost nine fighters, including a commander, when two helicopters crashed this week in neighboring Iraq

title: Jamaican government to increase minimum wage by 44%
description: Jamaican Prime Minister Andrew Holness says his administration is increasing the island’s minimum wage by 44% as the local economy rebounds

title: Burundi officials detect polio outbreak linked to vaccine
description: Health officials in Burundi have declared an outbreak of polio linked to the vaccine, the first time the paralytic disease has been detected in the east African country for more than three decades

title: First Republic, SVB, Credit Suisse: The latest banks in trouble and why
description: First Republic Bank is the fourth bank in trouble in the past week, as officials seek to stem fears of a wider financial crisis.

title: The Cure for Ticketmaster? Band says it has secured fee refund for fans.
description: The Cure's Robert Smith said he was "sickened" by high fees for his band's North America tour, and had secured a partial refund from Ticketmaster for fans.

title: UN rights chief decries 'systematic repression' in Belarus
description: The U.N. human rights chief called on Belarus to end its “systematic repression” of critics and immediately release people held on political grounds, saying some violations may amount to crimes against humanity

title: Finland's president in Turkey for talks on NATO bid
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is meeting his Finnish counterpart in Ankara amid hopes that Turkey approves Finland’s NATO membership bid

title: Turkey expected to back Finland for NATO membership, snub Sweden
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has played spoiler for much of the past 10 months.

title: Death toll rises, locals pick up pieces after Cyclone Freddy
description: Authorities are still getting to grips with the scale of Cyclone Freddy’s destruction in Malawi and Mozambique since late Saturday, with over 370 people confirmed dead and several hundreds still displaced or missing

title: Prince Harry sues tabloid for defamation over security story
description: Lawyers for Prince Harry have asked a judge to rule that a tabloid newspaper libeled the British royal with an article about his quest for police protection when he and his family visit the U.K. Harry is suing Mail on Sunday publisher Associated Newspapers Ltd

title: European team ends questioning of Lebanon Central Bank chief
description: Lebanese judicial officials say that a European legal team has finished two days of questioning of the country’s central bank governor in a money-laundering probe linked to the governor

title: China’s Xi to meet Putin in Russia next week
description: It's the strongest show of Beijing’s support for Moscow since the war in Ukraine began.

title: At least 10 people dead in house fire in northwest Pakistan
description: Officials say a fire raged through a wooden house in northwest Pakistan, killing 10 people, including women and children

title: Russia to award pilots involved in US drone incident
description: Russia’s Defense Ministry says fighter pilots involved in an incident with a U.S. drone that resulted in its crash will be given state awards

title: Cambodia celebrates return of 'priceless' stolen artifacts
description: Centuries-old cultural artifacts that had been illegally smuggled out from Cambodia have been welcomed home at a celebration led by Prime Minister Hun Sen, who offered thanks for their return and appealed for further efforts to retrieve such stolen treasures

title: Elite officers in Israel's military plan Sunday walkout
description: Hundreds of elite officers in Israel’s military reserves say they will not show up for duty starting on Sunday in protest over the ruling coalition’s planned overhaul of the judicial system

title: Russia is using old oil tankers to bypass export sanctions, risking spills
description: Fewer ships are willing to load oil at Russian ports on the Gulf of Finland, where even a small problem could be disastrous.

title: Pakistan athlete who died in migrant boat crash laid to rest
description: Mourners have attended the funeral of a Pakistani female field hockey player who died in a migrant boat crash off Italy’s coast last month

title: Mozambicans march to honor protest rapper after his death
description: Mozambicans are planning marches across the country to honor Azagaia, a popular protest rapper and fierce government critic, who died last week

title: France protests: What to know as Macron forces a retirement-age hike
description: The French government angered protesters after using Article 49.3, an executive power, to raise the retirement age without the consent of the National Assembly.

title: South Korea wanted a 69-hour workweek. Young people weren’t having it.
description: The proposal saw President Yoon's disapproval ratings rise among South Koreans in their 20s and 30s, who already work some of the longest hours in the world.

title: FIFA drops plan for Saudi agency to sponsor Women’s World Cup
description: The potential deal was criticized by soccer stars and hosts Australia and New Zealand, who highlighted Saudi Arabia's poor record on women and LGBTQ rights.

title: As settler violence surges, Palestinians say they have nowhere to turn
description: Two weeks after settlers rampaged through Palestinian villages and towns, killing one man and torching homes, residents wonder when justice will come.

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.S. says no change in F-16 stance after Poland’s move to send jets
description: U.S. officials are also investigating the collision between a U.S. drone and a Russian fighter jet over the Black Sea, according to Secretary of State Blinken.

title: 20 years later, U.S. invasion of Iraq hangs over war in Ukraine
description: “Who remembers anymore that, in 2003, we were Vladimir Putin?” a historian of the Middle East said.
